entries.content: Get a commitment from the prospect at the beginning of the meeting that they will make a decision (yes or no) by the end of the meeting.
Closing is getting a commitment from the prospect on whether or not you will move forward, based on a prior agreement.
At the end of the meeting, ask: 'Based on the answers I've given and the questions I've asked, do you believe I can help you?'
If the prospect says 'yes' you can help, ask: 'What do you want to do? What's the next step?'
When asking for the next step, refer back to the initial agreement made at the beginning of the meeting.
Closing is about getting the right outcome, which is a clear decision (yes or no), not necessarily getting the deal.

focus_area: Handling "Think About It": "What specifically?", Conditional closing
